lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone...

speaker: Director
lines: It's time for the Regulators to roll out. We're sending you in to detain and extract Lucas for his abuse of confidential information. Standard protocol applies.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You pull out from inside an old compact mirror. Inside is actually just a circular disk of emerald.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so he's stealing technological ideas from our world.

speaker: Noelle
lines: Guys, he's crystallizin’!

speaker: Travis
lines: I turn around and chop it off! [Noelle GUYS!] I chop it off!

speaker: Clint
lines: Quit chopping me off!

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna chop it off!

speaker: Clint
lines: You're choppin’ off my damn arm! Seriously!

speaker: Justin
lines: If we need a new arm, the good news is, he's got lots.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: So if we could figure out a way to make that work? That would be rad.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah. I'm unconscious, thanks.

speaker: Justin
lines: That's not what unconscious people say, but let's keep moving.

speaker: Announcer
lines: I hope Merle's proficient in unarmed combat! ...I'm sorry, I'm better than that, and you should expect more from me. It's the Adventure Zone!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: We come to you live from— a breaking news story— a tragedy, a tragedy that has—

speaker: [Over this, Justin and Travis make beeping "breaking news" sound effects.]
Griffin
lines: Oh my God. Well, don't both do it. When they do breaking news at TV stations, they don't have two different beep-a-deeps.

speaker: Travis
lines: But they do have someone live do it, like on Carmen Sandiego, when Rockapella would do the breaking news.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, but if Rockapella did it, they'd be fucking harmonizing and stuff. Anyway, breaking news story Dad has just touched Justin's dice.

speaker: Justin
lines: He touched my dice, he got it— whatever it is, he got it all over them. [Justin sounds a little low and raspy from a cold.]

speaker: Clint
lines: Guuhh. Get over it, dork!

speaker: Travis
lines: That's not— you're not supposed to touch—

speaker: Clint
lines: I'm a rebel, man! I got attitude! I got serious attitude!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It sounds like Justin has implied that there's some sort of residue that Dad has left on the dice.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sticky Coke Zero fingers...

speaker: Justin
lines: Not bad, it's just like, whatever he does—

speaker: Clint
lines: Critical misses, you mean?

speaker: Justin
lines: Just, his critical stink is all over it right now. And I'm worried that like—

speaker: Travis
lines: Critical Stink is a great D&D punk band name.

speaker: Justin
lines: [English punk voice] Oi, we're Critical Stink, let's roll! [noises imitating punk music]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Before we get into the—

speaker: Travis
lines: [snickering] Let's roll!

speaker: Justin
lines: Thank you, Travis. Somebody appreciated it.

speaker: Travis
lines: I liked it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Before we get into the excitement and action and resolution and shit, I feel like we need to do some corrections and amendments here at the top.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just— Dad does have an ax, but it's a— and I, he announced it in the first episode, and people were kind enough to remind me that Dad does have an ax— [distant thunder sound] Wow! Y'all hear that?

speaker: Justin
lines: What's that?

speaker: Griffin
lines: That's some fuckin' atmo! It's stormy as hell.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh!

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just know that that's not in post, it's not storming inside of Lucas's lab. Um... Dad does have a hand ax, he announced it in episode one, but it's basically a hatchet, it's like a hatchet that they would use in like— a child would get for Christmas—

speaker: Travis
lines: Like you would use in the book... Hatchet?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like a Gary Paulsen hatchet.

speaker: Clint
lines: Hence the name Li'l Choppy.

speaker: Travis
lines: I also wanna say, the reason we didn't use the red barrels [during the tardigrade fight] is because we beat them anyways, pretty handily. I don't think we took a lot of damage. We didn't need the red barrels, and it wasn't until afterwards when all you punks got to hear Griffin say "the red barrels" that you went yeah— [crosstalk] like— hindsight, 20/20, you guys.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Another quick one, I learned this, I didn't— there's no such thing as negative Kelvin.

speaker: Travis
lines: But what if he's really sad?

speaker: Justin
lines: There also isn't, I think I said a thousand degrees Kelvin. That's not a thing either.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Anyway, I, uh... I'll uh, just one last, as long as we're piling on here, I've been saying the word "proboscis" wrong my whole fuckin' life.

speaker: Travis
lines: You know what we're not? A factual show. This is not about science and learning, it's about Dungeons and Dragons!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I saw somebody trying to defend me like, 'Well in this fantasy universe, maybe it's pronounced probiscis!' No. No, friend.

speaker: Justin
lines: You're embarrassing yourself.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, it's not probiscis?

speaker: Griffin
lines: My sweet friend, no. Proboscis, with an o.

speaker: Travis
lines: Jesus...

speaker: Clint
lines: Probiscis is a flower.

speaker: Travis
lines: No...

speaker: Justin
lines: I thought it was probiscis the whole time, is it not probiscis?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It's proboscis.

speaker: Clint
lines: Proboscis.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is probiscis like a weird West Virginia thing?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it's like aunt [pronounced ant], aunt [pronounced ahnt].

speaker: Travis
lines: All right. Let's play Doon-jens and Dray-guns and get on with it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Um, who needs a refresher, anybody? Dad— Merle's arm got chopped off.

speaker: Travis
lines: I just listened to it!

speaker: Justin
lines: One last correction. I'm sorry last week after we beat them that I didn't call them "fartigrades."

speaker: Travis
lines: Or nardigrades!

speaker: Griffin
lines: A gross factual error from Justin.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, it was incorrect of me.

speaker: Travis
lines: We got a lot of fanmail about it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: One thing we also need to resolve Merle, what is your dominant hand? 'Cause I think that's the one that we're gonna say got got. 'Cause I don't see why you would grab a thing with your non-dominant hand.

speaker: Travis
lines: I actually think he said he was ambidextrous.

speaker: Clint
lines: I did at the very beginning of the show, but along with all these other facts, I guess that was forgotten too...

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] It's been two years!

speaker: Travis
lines: It feels like five.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, if you wanna flip a coin and tell me which hand got got…

speaker: Clint
lines: I'll roll a die.

speaker: Justin
lines: While Dad's rolling that die to tell you which hand got got, I should also mention that very early in the show, I also said that whenever people are around Taako, they get super horny and want to give him lots of money. I said that and everybody was like, uh huh, good good good good.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, we like that- like that’s canon-

speaker: Travis
lines: I actually, I wrote that down.

speaker: Justin
lines: [slower, as if taking notes] They get super horny... and want to give him lots of money.

speaker: Clint
lines: I lost my dominant hand.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nice. Which is it, your right or left?

speaker: Clint
lines: My right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Taako, I actually remember the super horny, giving you money thing. Like, has that not... that's just how it's—

speaker: Justin
lines: I just have it. It's like my acrobatic skill, it just hasn't…

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just haven't used it. So about twenty minutes have passed since you guys got Merle into this medbay room.

speaker: Travis
lines: Merle's dead. He bled out.

speaker: Clint
lines: I'm dead, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And— he died between episodes. It's a D&D podcast first.

speaker: Travis
lines: But he's been recast, as a younger— this is Oliver, the new Merle…

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he is alive, and through a series of medicines and salves that Lucas has applied, you're actually pretty lucid, and the pain from your grisly wound has almost completely subsided.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hey, it was a very clean cut, thank you very much!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I meant gris— okay, yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Take pride in your work, Trav.

speaker: Travis
lines: It was surgical!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It was surgical in nature.

speaker: Travis
lines: I was surgical with this bitch!

speaker: Clint
lines: By the way, while we're on this subject, thanks to all those people who tweeted and said, 'here's hoping Merle dies!' Thank you!

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, everybody loves a shakeup, Dad, I don't think that that's personal against you, but like, you know, the interjection of an— who knows what celebrity we could get to play the next Merle!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The possibilities are very exciting. Let me, let's do some storytelling.

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait, wait, just to be clear—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, boy.

speaker: Justin
lines: —Travis, you're saying that we would not replace— let Dad play a new character, [Travis Uh-huh!] —we'd bring his old character back to life with a new actor, like Doctor Who.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, got it, cool. Got it. Perfect.

speaker: Clint
lines: Thanks! Thanks, bud!

speaker: Travis
lines: You could, you could come back as like maybe a whimsical spirit, or some kind of like, talking book…

speaker: Clint
lines: Sure, yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Or talking dog…

speaker: Justin
lines: Maybe more of a producer role in the back, taking a backseat, a Robin to our Howie… No?

speaker: Clint
lines: [cracks up] … Why am I laughing?

speaker: Justin
lines: I don't know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don't know. It's very sad. Merle—

speaker: Justin
lines: That's what you'll be doing a lot of, though. And you— a lot of, "Good one, sirs!"

speaker: Travis
lines: And you'll be asked to leave the set because you're interrupting the filming.

speaker: Justin
lines: "Excellent, young masters! Way to goof 'em again!"

speaker: Travis
lines: "Do you need any lem-o-nade?"

speaker: Justin
lines: "Thrilling plot twist!"

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Merle, you've been treated. What I'm trying to establish is, you're actually doing okay. Aside from, you're missing your right arm. And by right arm, it's mostly your forearm, it kind of just kind of stops at the elbow, and you're really thoroughly bandaged up on that arm. The bleeding has come to a stop. Things have calmed down in the past, in the twenty minutes that have passed.

speaker: Travis
lines: And just to be clear, when last we left, [Griffin Yeah.] Merle had explained to us that he heard a British guy, [Griffin Yeah.] who tricked him, [Griffin Yes.] and then Lucas, if I remember correctly, said, "I'll explain everything."

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, Lucas right now is actually in the corner, he's actually removed a panel from the wall of this medbay and you can see he's got some sort of like, hastily constructed terminal that he's like, rewiring some stuff in the panels, and he's like, fiddling with this terminal, and as he does, you can hear sort of rumbling and some ambient noises coming from pretty far off in the lab.

speaker: And in this medbay, now that things have calmed down, you've actually got a chance to sort of take in your surroundings. There's some cabinets with medical equipment and medicines, there is some sort of scanning device, and there is a null suit chamber, much like the one that you guys had in the Bureau of Balance, it's maybe a little bit smaller than the one that you have in your lab that you used to suit up at the beginning of this adventure, and hanging off of the side of it are— is a suit, that is Lucas-sized, it is human-shaped. And Lucas stops messing with this panel that he's fiddling with, and he goes,
Lucas
lines: Okay, I've rewired and shut down most of the rest of my lab, it should buy us about an hour and a half to get downstairs and shut this thing down.

speaker: Magnus
lines: That should give us about an hour and 29 minutes for you to explain what the holy hell is going on, and one minute to get downstairs.

speaker: Lucas
lines: [sigh] There... [sigh] what don't, what don't you already know? Some— There was an accident, and somebody—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oookay, what don't we know? I got a compact, lets me see into some strange world, A. B, there's a voice that keeps talking to us. C, some British guy more or less took Merle's hand. D, what the fuck is happening?

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, ah, he really shifted blame— that, I mean— [crosstalk]

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, some British guy—

speaker: Justin
lines: He's exorcised himself from the story, huh— [crosstalk]

speaker: Magnus
lines: Listen, if you— if somebody got stabbed with a sword would you say the sword killed him? No. I was merely the tool that operated on Merle, through this British guy— I was a tool.

speaker: Justin
lines: Travis is telling his shield, "I don't know, I never cut his hand off… "

speaker: Clint
lines: So this is like, guns don't kill people…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus takes axes, kills arms.

speaker: Justin
lines: Got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Actually, before we get started, Merle, I had an idea. Because we're gonna need your clerical ways as we go deeper, and I was thinking, I had a kind of idea of how I could maybe restore some of your two-handedness? If that makes sense?

speaker: Merle
lines: I'm listening. I'm a little grumpy, [Lucas Okay.] as everybody can understand...

speaker: Travis
lines: A little put off.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Magnus, I understand that you may have taken a little trophy from Hodge Podge after defeating him. Can I see it?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uhhh gimme a minute to find it. [Travis Rustle rustle rustle.] Not this one... not this one... not this one... not this one... this? No, not this one... is it this—? No not that one...

speaker: Clint
lines: Boy, you are really well-armed. [Griffin laughter]

speaker: Magnus
lines: Is it this one?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Yeah, that's it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes it, and uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: God, I was so hoping Griffin would say no.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes the right arm and he holds it up to Merle, and it's really little. It's like a small, like a doll's arm. Like a toy, like a GI Joe arm. He's like,

speaker: Lucas
lines: No, I'm just— I'm just kidding, that would be... that would be ridiculous, it's like a little toy arm. Like if I could somehow plug this into you, how would you control it? That's sci-fi bullshit. Robot arms.

speaker: Clint
lines: Today the part of Merle being played by Kristen Wiig.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Can you imagine? Uh, he actually goes back to that desk where he was messing around with a belt and a petri dish, where he was messing around, and you see him—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Can I have that arm back please?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Well, I need a piece off of it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He unscrews this, like, cap at the end of it, and attaches it to this thing that he's tinkering with. And as he's tinkering with it, Carey comes back into the room, and she says,

speaker: Carey
lines: Hey, I'm back! I’ve uh, I got what you asked me to get from Jamie.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she is holding a potted plant with these four wooden shoots, it looks like, coming out of it. And if you'll recall, you saw this very briefly when you went into the bugbear chamber. And Lucas goes,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, no, this is the idea. This is going to be great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he takes that plant and removes it, de-pots it, takes it out, and as he's like taking it out of the pot and shaking the dirt off of its roots, you actually see the plant kind of protest? Like it's like trying to slap his hand away? And he plants it in this petri dish that you can see has some sort of green viscous fluid in it, and he sprays it down with something. He picks it up, and it just kind of looks like this wooden plant is hanging off of this belt. And he creates—

speaker: Travis
lines: Feed me, Lucas!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He creates some sort of concoction that he walks over to Merle, and he says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Here, drink this. Trust me. Please. This is gonna be so sick. This is— Merle, I know you’ve been burned by people asking you to do stuff that maybe you don’t trust, in the past like 15 minutes, but trust me on this, this is gonna be tight as hell.

speaker: Merle
lines: Sure. I’ll do it. Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your other arm falls off.

speaker: Merle
lines: I'm really down, so, yeah, go ahead, kick me while I— I'm vulnerable, I feel very vulnerable right now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so you're downing this bev…

speaker: Clint
lines: Mm! It's like an appletini!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It actually tastes more like a carbonated wheatgrass shot. [Justin Nice.] It doesn't taste especially great. But as you taste it, and as you drink it, you see this wooden— these four wooden shoots hanging off of this belt kind of come to a standstill and start to wrap around each other and tie around each other, and they form what looks like kind of a crude four-fingered arm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Lucas explains, he says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, so biology's not my specialty, but this is definitely gonna work. This is a plant called soulwood, and it's a psychically tuned plant that can resonate with certain people that resonate with them, and it can sort of change its biology based on the whims of other living creatures. And Merle, from what I understand, plants are kind of your specialty, um, so—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Romantically.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Romantically speaking. So, my thinking is— do you mind? I'm gonna get close, I'm gonna get intimate.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell yes, ASMR.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He starts whispering in nerd ASMR.

speaker: Lucas
lines: [low nasal whispering] Okay, so what it's gonna do…

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes this belt and wraps it around your shoulder, and then there's another fastener which goes around your chest, and as he's doing this—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Merle, how do you feel about auto-erotic asphyxiation?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as he's doing this, he is straight up, like, Army of Darkness, attaching this wooden arm to you that is now roughly the size— it's actually kind of bigger than your other arm—

speaker: Travis
lines: I chop it off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh no. That didn't last very long at all, huh.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I don't. Not this time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you have this wooden arm, and you feel this like, this psychic link with it. You feel like a deep connection with this arm made up of these four wooden shoots that have twisted around each other to form the shape of an arm.

speaker: Clint
lines: Awesome...?

speaker: Travis
lines: So I guess it all worked out!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, everything worked out for the best!

speaker: Justin
lines: Worked out fine.

speaker: Clint
lines: I want you to feel completely off the hook, Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: And then Magnus and Merle engage in a very complicated like high five secret handshake so he can test out the hand, we do the Shimmy Shimmy Cocoa Pop, the Bureau handshake—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, as you do the secret Merle and Magnus handshake, Merle, you feel like it is not a big deal to move this thing at all. It takes maybe a little bit to become as dextrous with it as you were your original OG dwarf hand, but yeah, you have pretty good control over this soulwood arm. And it actually like kind of curls up towards you and gives you a big thumbs-up as if to say, hey! I'm your arm now!

speaker: Clint
lines: Wow! Creepy! Really creepy! Yeah! Good. That's really gonna cut back on my fireworks—

speaker: Travis
lines: I want it in the canon—

speaker: Justin
lines: And hey, good news, now you got somebody to blame for your rolls. [Travis laughs] It's the tree!

speaker: Travis
lines: I want it in the canon that Magnus is actually like a little bit jealous of his sweet new wooden arm. Not out loud, mind you, but just quietly to himself.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I would like it in canon that Magnus can kiss my Kenny Chesney tattoo.

speaker: Travis
lines: Fair. All of this is fair.

speaker: Justin
lines: Can you imagine what delectable torture that would be though, for Magnus, to have a tree on his arm that he cannot split.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, true…

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, he can.

speaker: Travis
lines: Can Magnus make a tree even he can’t split?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So in terms of mechanics, Merle, you now have just a permanent disadvantage on sleight of hand rolls. That's just— your days of having good sleight of hand rolls are behind you.

speaker: Clint
lines: My days of having any good rolls are behind me!

speaker: Griffin
lines: But! You can now control this hand separately from yourself. You can take it off, chuck it, control it like you would normally, [Travis What?!] like your hand, only you can control it remotely.

speaker: Travis
lines: Awesome.

speaker: Justin
lines: So it gave him superpowers, basically. Great.

speaker: Travis
lines: More so than the magic he could already wield, you know, summoning angels and all that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus cuts both his legs off. Like, all right! Juice me up!

speaker: Travis
lines: What've you got for me?!

speaker: Justin
lines: Taako cuts his head off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Lucas says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, so we don't have a lot of time for you to get acclimated to your new arm, so you're gonna have to figure it out on the fly, but before we get out there, you're gonna need to recharge your suits.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Noelle says,

speaker: Noelle
lines: Oh! That's right! Oh gosh! Sorry, I completely blanked.

speaker: And a little compartment opens up and a tank pops out that looks very much like the tank of spray that they plugged into the chamber when you first got sprayed down to null-suit yourselves. And Lucas slips into his null suit and plugs the tank into the chamber, and he's like,
Lucas
lines: Alright, everybody, pile on in! It's time to recharge!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I guess very awkwardly, because there's more of you now, you're doing like a Real World/Road Rules like, how many co-eds can we fit into a phone booth challenge... you all get coated in another layer of null-suit juice. The meters, you have these little panels on your wrist that are showing how much energy you have left in your null suits, are completely full up now. And everybody gets all sprayed down.

lines: And may I say, in Amazon reviews, I'm giving the null suits originally one thumbs down…

lines: [laughs] That's not how Amazon reviews work.

speaker: Clint
lines: I couldn't pass up a thumb joke.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, that's— good point. We're gonna have a lot of those now, I bet.

lines: Hey Lucas, while we're all showering together…

lines: Yeah?

lines: "What is that?" [crosstalk]

lines: When Merle—

lines: You're standing on my thigh, which is weird.

lines: Thank you for the boost. When Merle mentioned a British guy, did that ring any bells for you?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay. I swear, guys? The lying stuff? Is over now. I have no fucking idea what—

lines: But you realize that like this is an all-audio medium, so all I can do is ask questions, right? I can't look around and observe…

lines: No, I get it. Um, if you want, I can tell you all about the compact…

lines: Yeah! That'd be cool!

lines: It'll be easier if I show you the Cosmoscope. Can you guys— are you guys ready to roll?

lines: Yeah.

lines: Uh... [clears throat]

lines: [voice strained and breaking] Yeah.

lines: Yeah... still in a lot of pain, but okay.

lines: [voice breaking a lot] Let's do it.

lines: Justin, I wanna hear your—

lines: The role of Taako today will be played by a ghost.

lines: The Cold and Flu version of Taako should be interesting.

lines: Yeah. Taako silently nods in agreement.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You guys make your way out of the med bay and through the decontamination chamber back into the central hub. This room is kind of a mess because the crystal golem started to form in here and kind of fucked shit up, as he was like breaking pieces of crystal off. And you make your way into the door that you saw earlier that was labeled 'The Cosmoscope.' And as you pass through the airlock into the Cosmoscope you enter into what you assume to be a pretty large chamber, although it is like, completely pitch black in here. Save for a pillar of light which is illuminating what looks like a circular disk that is kind of free-floating in the middle of the room, facing you. And uh, Lucas walks into the back of the room, into the darkness. You see him get out a flashlight and you can see he's messing with some sort of lectern back there…

speaker: Travis
lines: Time for scary stories!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: This is the tale of the... [stalling] old... sailor's... mummy!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, he flips some switches on this lectern and you see an image pop up on this disk, and it looks like the lab that you are currently standing in, as seen from above, from outside of the lab. And he says,

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, I’m about to get into some pretty heavy concepts. Um, I’m probably going to blow your whole mind and just kinda reshape the way you think about existence and stuff. So if it ever gets to be too much or you have any questions, please feel free to stop me, okay?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay wait stop you’re blowing my mind.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay. Boy, this is gonna take forever, I bet. Let’s take this slow. My whole life, I have been obsessed with the concepts of taxonomy and hierarchy. That, for everything that exists, there’s always a bigger thing that contains it.

speaker: Magnus
lines: There’s always someone cooler than you, right?

speaker: Lucas
lines: That’s one way of putting it, yeah. So there’s always a bigger thing that has a bigger thing that contains it, and so on and so forth, repeated on to just inconceivable degrees.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Turtles all the way down.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Turtles all the way down. Turtles all the way up. Bigger turtles. So…

speaker: Griffin
